newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan construction shares up on recovery hopes.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan construction shares up on recovery hopes.

text.p: Taiwan's construction shares soared at mid-morning on Friday, reflecting widespread expectations that the island's long-sluggish property market was recovering, brokers said.
With 70 minutes left, at 0250 GMT, the entire construction sector had risen 6.29 percent, while the main index was up 1.45 percent.
Ever Fortune topped the gainers' list, surging by the daily seven percent limit to T$35.1. Ruentex Construction rose T$1.1 or 4.95 percent to T$23.3.
Pacific Construction advanced T$1.8 or 6.16 percent to T$31.
Brokers said the construction industry has showed signs of recovery.
Loans extended by Taiwan banks to construction firms grew 0.8 percent to T$404.230 billion year-on-year in May, marking the first rise in two years, the central bank said on Friday.
The figure had gradually recovered since it fell 20.66 percent year-on-year in September 1996. This indicates a gradual bottoming-out of the real estate market, the bank said in a statement.
"Many people have expected the stock rally to help boost the sluggish property market," United Securities' analyst Lin Long-hsien said.
